title: Codec-Based Deepfake Source Tracing via Neural Audio Codec Taxonomy
author: Xuanjun Chen (National Taiwan University), I-Ming Lin (National Taiwan University), Lin Zhang (National Taiwan University), Jiawei Du (National Taiwan University), Haibin Wu (Brno University of Technology), Hung-yi Lee (National Taiwan University), Jyh-Shing Roger Jang (National Taiwan University), ..., Haibin Wu (Independent Researcher)
relevance_why: The paper discusses source tracing mechanisms for deepfakes generated by codec-based speech generation models, which may enhance Haohe's work on speech restoration and generative audio models.
background: Identifying the source of deepfake audio generated by neural audio codecs, which allows for better detection and understanding of audio-based misinformation.
contribution: This paper introduces a source tracing method based on a taxonomy of neural audio codecs to address the challenges in identifying the origins of CodecFake deepfakes, achieving promising results in experimental trials.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily focused on detecting deepfake audio without tracing back to the generative models.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work differentiates itself by categorizing neural audio codecs and proposing a multi-task learning framework that improves the source tracing of CodecFake deepfakes.

key_innovation: The introduction of a structured taxonomy for neural audio codecs, which allows for improved source tracing of various deepfake models.
real_world_impact: This framework has the potential to aid in the identification and mitigation of misinformation spread through audio deepfakes, contributing to the integrity of audio communications.
limitations: The model's performance declines with the increase in variability from known to unknown deepfake systems, indicating a sensitivity to unseen codecs.

new_terms.CodecFake: **CodecFake** refers to deepfake audio generated specifically using neural audio codecs, which can produce highly realistic synthetic speech.
new_terms.taxonomy: **Taxonomy** in this context categorizes different neural audio codec types and their components, enabling structured analysis and identification.

open_sourcing: The authors plan to release their entire codebase to facilitate further research.
